result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Donnelly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 90 days or penalty of 5 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R Donnelly

defendant.name: Donnelly, Matthew R
defendant.address: 4986 S Small Road, New Berlin, WI 53151

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew R Donnelly in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend Count #2 to county ordinance disorderly conduct.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge (domestic abuse enhancer is stricken) and imposes fine of $267.50 - to be paid in 90 days, alternate 5 days jail if not paid. Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew R Donnelly in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin requests that case be taken off jury trial as Defendant is engaged in counseling and will accept state's offer upon completion of counseling.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State may be requesting adjournment due to lab analyst's schedule.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
to appear filed by Attorney Morin

Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Matthew R Donnelly did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin requests a jury status and jury trial date.    Bail remains as fixed.

Defendant Matthew R Donnelly in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin requests and adjournment.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew R Donnelly in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he did qualify for public defender representation but they were not able to appoint yet for today.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.   Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim/witness listed in the complaint.

Defendant Matthew R Donnelly in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
